page.title: 03BRADLEY WOOD
page.content: {Bradley Wood}is off{Belper}Road.At the west end of the wood all the trees are deciduous,they are mainly silver birch and oak.The soil is sandy.Up the west hill going to the{airfield}the trees are old and just oak trees are covering the hill.A little further up are some coniferous trees bearing cones.The{airfield}is now disused. Part of it is used for growing crops. The runway is still there and beside it there is muddy ground.The east end of the wood is mainly fir trees.The bracken is about five feet tall and the bracken from last year slowly rots away.Eventually you can turn left running parallel to the road where oak trees take over again and the bracken comes back. There are lots of rabbits,squirrels ,foxes and birds in the wood. {By Andrew Croton
